channel.title: Developer quotes on release and process
channel.description:
Good morning, and welcome to the Developer Quotes for the searchless thread. This thread is a collection of quotes and locales by the BM:S developers concerning the release date and mod progress.
[b]Release time![/b]
[b]So? So?[/b] [quote="cman2k"] We're freaking out over here! It is so exciting to share this news with you!
* You can now Download the Black Mesa Soundtrack, courtesy of our very own Joel Nielsen, at the very generous price of whatever you want! Enjoy and share! * In the near future you'll see our Website, Wiki and Forums all taken down temporarily for renovations. * On September 14th you will see the first release of Black Mesa! This will include our re-envisioning of Half-Life all the way up to Lambda Core. We believe this is a great way to provide a complete-feeling 8-10 hour experience with a solid ending, make our fans happy and help us make the best overall game possible.
We are still working hard on Xen and BMDM, but instead of making you wait we are giving you Black Mesa as soon as it's ready! We're doing our best to help bring the immense vision of this project into reality, and we are very excited for what the future brings!
High-Fives Yo, Carlos Montero - Project Leader [/quote] [b]Won't your servers die under the traffic?[/b] [quote="Hubicorn"] We will be ready, don't you worry. [/quote] [b]What's the size of the upcomming download?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] A touch over three gigabytes last time I checked. [/quote] [b]Would having recent HL series games be enough, or should we also download and install Source SDK 2007 [i]explicitly[/i]?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] The SourceSDK Base 2007 is the only thing you need to have installed. If you don't have it installed when you try to launch Black Mesa, Steam will download it for you. You don't need the SourceSDK (i.e. the development tools), you need the SourceSDK [i]Base[/i], which is a stripped-out version of the engine that any mod can use to launch its own codebase. It only contains the core executables and shared assets. [/quote] [b]Would Xen be completely removed?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] No. Development on xen is already underway and we hope to have it finished up in a reasonable timeframe. Xen is going to basically be a complete game in its own right, it's not going to be just an epilogue to the game; more of a whole new chapter. It'll be pretty well expanded. [/quote] [b]Is Xen gonna be a separate game?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] It will be in the form of an update that adds the Xen chapters to Black Mesa. It will make the transition from Lambda Core to Xen seamless. [/quote] [b]Will Xen be released with Deathmatch?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] It [Xen] will be an update. Black Mesa: Deathmatch will be a separate game. They'll be released at the same time, but they will be separate games. [/quote] [b]When can we expect Xen?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] It won't be this year. [/quote] [b]Will we see a bit of Xen during resonance cascade?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] Yes [/quote] [b]Was the decision to release Xen later made years/months ago, or just weeks/days ago?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] It wasn't made that recently, but recent events confirmed that it was the correct course of action. [/quote] [b]Would here be subtitles translations?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] We should be making the subtitles available for translation sometime soon. [/quote] [b]Will we be able to use the mod's assets in G-Mod?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] Yes, but you'll need to copy them across yourself. [/quote] [b]Will there be a port to the Xbox 360?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] No. [/quote] [b]Will there be a port to Linux version of Source?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] If we can port our codebase over easily, we will probably support Linux. [/quote] [b]Will Black Mesa's assets be made available for lesser modders?[/b] [quote="Raminator"] No. You'll be able to make maps and mods for Black Mesa, but you won't be able to use our assets in your own mod. [/quote] [b]--------------------------------------------------------------[/b]
[b]Older stuff:[/b] New media can often be found in the WIKI: [url]https://www.wiki.blackmesasource.com/Special:NewFiles[/url]
A dev portfolio with some new stuff: [url]https://www.oggyart.com[/url]
JamesKane keeps a blog with occasional updates here: [url]https://www.gnosistheprogrammer.com[/url]
[b]Is this facebook stirring the build-up thingy you've been talking about? (2012-june-12)[/b] [quote="Raminator"] Yes, this is the beginning. [/quote] [b]Then why did it die out? (2012-aug-08 )[/b] [quote="CatzEyes93"] Just so everyone is clear, the "campaign" will not be moving forward. When Carlos posted the screenshots and hinted that there would be more to come, there was some backlash from the community because screenshots were released instead of the game itself. Apparently at this stage, folks want the release and ONLY the release. Nothing else will do. [/quote]
[quote="Raminator"] Nothing was cancelled as a result of "community backlash". Our plans have changed recently, but those changes had nothing to do with people complaining about Facebook or Twitter, or us releasing screenshots instead of the game. We're not reading too much into any negativity that may have been generated, and we're not giving up because someone on the internet said something mean about us. I think there's just been a miscommunication somewhere at some point. [/quote] [b]What about that gameplay video all over the net? (2012-aug-08 )[/b] [url]https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=12124[/url]
Are you going to release Black Mesa on Christmas 2011? [quote="Raminator"] We're not releasing the mod for Christmas. [/quote] Will Black Mesa be released early to reviewers? [quote="Raminator"] We're not releasing the mod early for reviews. [/quote] Why are there no official updates? [quote=Raminator] That's the thing, we've already tried all of this, and it got us nowhere. We tried doing frequent news updates; people complained. We tried doing large new updates; people complained. We tried setting up a devblog; people complained. We tried releasing video trailers; people complained. We tried setting up a YouTube channel; people complained. We tried setting up a Twitter account; people complained. Do you see where this is going?
No matter what we do, people are going to complain, so it makes the most sense to do nothing. We can't keep everyone happy, and it's a waste of development time to even try, especially at this late stage. We have more important things to do. [/quote]
[quote=Raminator] The people who complained that there wasn't enough media or that the Twitter/YouTube stuff wasn't of a high enough standard/interesting enough were a lot more vocal than the people who thought it was enough. We can only act on the feedback we receive though, and here we are today. [/quote] Why not even update the website, remove the inactive pieces like twitter feed? [quote="Raminator"] I don't think it's accurate to say that we don't want to keep the page updated, but at this stage the slightest change kicks up way too much hype. Did you see how many people flooded the forums a few weeks ago thinking the mod was about to be released just becase Hubi added a few pictures to the front page? There's no sense in creating a stir about the mod until it's ready to be released, or we'll just end up disappointing people. Announcing we're still alive and working is pretty much cold comfort, and the end result isn't any different to where we are now. [/quote] Any chance of release in 2011? [quote="JamesKane"] It is possible, [b]but there is [u]no[/u] guarantee. [/b]
I have been working on BM daily and will continue up until school starts in late September. I know others will be making a push as well but not as many as I would like. I will be posting updates on my blog a lot more frequently and possibly post semi-weekly reports. [/quote] 2009 release failure reasoning: [quote=Raminator] When we made the trailer, we had every intention of releasing in 2009; it was an aggressive deadline, but at the time we were confident that we could make it. We were making good progress, but we had no way of knowing how the events of the following year would play out. We tried our best, but the game wasn't finished. Sure, you can get all butthurt about how we lied to you, but the fact of the matter is that not making 2009 was as big a surprise and disappointment to us as it was to all of you.
Everyone underestimates how important their real lives are (or how important other people's real lives are to them). We've lost a lot of manpower over the last eighteen months because most of the team are busy at work, have assignments at school, have family commitments, are seeking employment, are raising children, renovating their homes... the kind of unexpected things you can't ignore because they're up there in your face. They have to take precedence over something you do on your computer in your spare time, and it makes it very difficult to maintain enough manpower to finish such a large and ambitious mod in a timely fashion. We're not slacking off, we're not wasting time, we're not delaying out of spite, we're not incompetent. We're trying. [/quote] Was there a chance of release back then? [quote=Raminator] Near the end of 2008, we figured that if development continued at its (then) current rate, we'd be able to wrap up the remainder of the game in about a year's time, maybe a little more. As 2009 wore on, it became increasingly apparent that that wasn't going to be the case, for reasons we've already explained. We spent a little time re-evaluating our position and goals, setting up a series of internal deadlines leading up to a release date later on. So far we've been hitting those milestones reasonably consistently and we're still on-track to meeting our release date. [/quote] Now what? [quote=Raminator] A variety of things, really. We weren't able to keep up the pace to finish the game for our 2009 deadline, mostly due to family/work/school commitments. We've been using the extra time since then to improve the mod, reworking large segments of it, going over a lot of the core stuff; all on a smaller team than before. There's not a lot left to go, we're basically just fixing and improving things. [/quote]
[quote=Raminator] In December 2009, we re-evaluated everything we'd accomplished up to that point. We decided that a lot of what we had wasn't up to scratch anymore, and we've spent a lot of the intervening time redoing or improving things that were already deemed complete. The Black Mesa of 2011 is a much, much better game than the Black Mesa of 2009 in every sense. I'll be grabbing some 2009/2011 comparison screenshots in the lead-up to the release, just to put the delay into perspective. [/quote]
[quote=Raminator] Real-life commitments delayed us to the point that a 2009 release just wasn't possible; after that we re-evaluated where we were and where we wanted to be, and we realised that some of the stuff we'd deemed complete was no longer up to the standards of the rest of the game. We've spent a lot of the intervening time replacing and improving large chunks of gameplay and assets; the current version of Black Mesa is a much better game than the Black Mesa that could have been released in 2009. [/quote] "When it's done" [quote=Raminator] Black Mesa does have an internal schedule and development pipeline, it has for many years now. The operative word there was "internal"; the community is not privy to this information because of the way these things are always twisted and misconstrued. We adjust goals, targets, areas of focus, etc. to keep up with where development actually is, not just where it's meant to be.
That's why we set the 2009 deadline, that's why we re-evaluated where the mod was and where we wanted to be when we missed that deadline. We keep these milestones and dates to ourselves because they're obviously a bit plastic. "When it's done" isn't an internal development philosophy, but it's a bit more polite than saying "we know, but we aren't telling you because we don't trust you to not flip out". [/quote] Promise from 23-06-10, and it's dismissal on 01-02-11: [quote=Raminator] If we continue hitting milestones at our current rate of progress, Black Mesa will be released within the next twelve months regardless of whether we meet our internal deadline. [/quote]
[quote="Raminator"] We weren't able to continue to hit milestones at that rate of progress. [/quote] What is being worked on, as of 11-02-11: [quote="JamesKane"] Since it has been said, we are in the later parts of development. Most of the work now is piecing together finished assets, rebuilding broken mechanics, and fixing up bugs ( Each are quite time consuming ). Some developers have extra time, while waiting on another task to be finished, so he can do his job. His extra time will either be used to work another task or fix/update stuff on a list we have of things to do but not required. The developer may work from the list because those tasks are usually more refreshing and allows the developer to have fun so he wont get burnt out. [/quote] Why there are no job requests for translations (04-05-11): [quote="JamesKane"] We did not start editing the file [english text strings] until recently. Organizing information needed took months. Actually adding the information and correcting the the spelling/grammar is taking time. We have to not only add dialog but add all the new sounds we have added. Slow process.
It currently has 3k lines. I'm not sure what is left as it is not my department. [/quote] Soundtrack and release binding (11-03-11): [quote="Raminator"] The soundtrack will be released two weeks before the mod. Just because the soundtrack is finalised doesn't mean it is going to be available for download yet [/quote] Website updates and release binding (16-04-11): [quote="Raminator"] The webpage and forums will all be drastically updated in the weeks leading up to the release, but there probably won't be anything more before that. [/quote] From Steamcast, august 2011 [quote] We just recently finished On A Rail and the only remaining bits are the very ending of Lambda Core and polishing
It's really been in a playtesting phase for about a year or two [/quote] How often do you guys cycle through playtesters? They must get bored and less useful at some point. (29-09-11): [quote="JamesKane"] It has come to the point where we grab our friends/family/school mates and say hey play this pls. [/quote] Is current build playable from start to end? (19-10-11): [quote="JamesKane"] pretty much [/quote] What is the state of affairs on 06-11-2011: [quote="JamesKane"] Here is what known:
* I cannot comment on what levels are exactly finished nor an estimated release. However, you can play from start to what we consider to be the end in our plans for the first release. * The creatures and humanoids all work and will be constantly updated up to release using suggestions from the forums and ideas on the wish (but not required) list. * Remaining tasks include but are not limited to bug fixing, fixing choreo, improving sounds, improving performance, finishing scripting sequences, fleshing out lighting/textures/animations, and so on. * The 2010 and 2011 "release" were never official even though a team member may have been cocky and said otherwise. The entire team must be on board with releasing any information on the release. * Development is slow. However, sometimes a team member may not be able to work until another member has finished a task. So while waiting he may work on experimen4al ideas or improvements. * I have plans to post different information tidbits up until release, but with work, school, and BM development it is hard to make time. * We are constantly letting family, friends, and co-works try out the mod. We use this information to improve it if possible. I even took my laptop to comic con and let a few folks play office, wgh, and some test levels. [/quote] A statement of the mod being very much alive (comment about lack of April 1st 2011 jokes on the site), approximation from my memory: [QUOTE=Raminator] We don't have time to waste on such nonsense. [/QUOTE] Plus a couple in post #2.
I hope this compilation will reduce the stream of identical questions somewhat. Also, i'm not omnipresent, so if you've seen (or done, dear devs) a related quote somewhere, please post it here.

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: omegalucas
item.description:
This should be added to the main post:

Is Xen gonna be a separate game?

Raminator:

It will be in the form of an update that adds the Xen chapters to Black Mesa. It will make the transition from Lambda Core to Xen seamless.

Will Xen be released with Deathmatch?

Raminator:

They’ll be released at the same time, but they will be separate games.

When can we expect Xen?

Raminator:

It won’t be this year.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
I’m pretty sure DM will be released after Xen, since it wouldn’t make much sense for them to work on DM and Xen at the same time (last I heard the entire team has input into Xen).

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
No official response to Steam or related Greenlight. Xen will come after the rest of the campaign, but will be larger and more of its own world than just a short epilogue stage. It is likely that DM will be released with Xen, but not absolutely sure.

Xen will not take 8 years.

I think that about sums it up.

Read full topic

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Raminator:

Nothing was cancelled as a result of “community backlash”. Our plans have changed recently, but those changes had nothing to do with people complaining about Facebook or Twitter, or us releasing screenshots instead of the game. We’re not reading too much into any negativity that may have been generated, and we’re not giving up because someone on the internet said something mean about us. I think there’s just been a miscommunication somewhere at some point.

Some more clarification about Catz’s statement.

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: striker
item.description:
This should be in the first post for the question about more trailers:

Katana:

I know I’d love to make a Black Mesa trailer with SFM, but only when I’m sure that I can’t contribute to any area of development - certainly don’t want to hold up release for that sake.
Of course, I feel like getting everything working there would require a lot of copying/pasting assets into the right directories, and then figuring out why X isn’t working…

Maybe my trailer will just be the Heavy calling the Scout over and saying “Look! Black Mesa is released!” in poor sentence-mixing.

Read full topic

correct

https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showpost.php?p=455046&postcount=18370

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: CygNuS
item.description:
Raminator:

He had just about wrapped up several years worth of work. I think you can forgive him for being excited about it.

“Soundtrack gone gold” was a quite dubious statement. I think you can forgive us for being excited/confused about it.

My suggestion “to please stick to the actual definition of words in the future” was not an attack to Joel, it was simply a reaction to stormseeker saying we sounded like a bunch of conspiracy theorists about this (while it shouldn’t be surprising we would, you’d start acting like one)

Read full topic
item.source: Developer quotes on release and process

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: TheDragonMask
item.description:
Katana:

I gotta be honest - a lot of the media blackout is because of the intense desire for release. I only speak for myself and I think this makes sense, but we were pretty disappointed in ourselves for not making the 2009 release predicted in the trailer, and at least for myself, that level of hype just stresses myself out, and since Black Mesa isn’t my job, it makes development less fun. Since I don’t get paid for it, I’m not going to put time into development if it’s not fun.

As a result, we no longer say anything because - at least on my part - I want people to forget about the mod’s existence for a little while, enjoy everything else life has to offer, and then be pleasantly surprised when we suddenly say out of nowhere “All right, we’re ready!”
Simultaneously, we don’t want to put out something subpar just because we demanded a certain release date of ourselves.

Katana, one of the choreographers if I’m not mistaken, has been posting a lot in the “Ask the developers” thread.

Read full topic
item.source: Developer quotes on release and process

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: Kerberos
item.description:
TrantaLocked:

The best thing one can do is stop visiting the forums frequently and live life to the fullest. I check back on forums every couple weeks for Black Mesa to see what is going on. After that I remember it will be awesome when it comes out, and the time will go by faster.

Same here it really takes the pressure off. :freeman:

TheDragonMask:

I’m just trying to get this forum to be less empty. It seems like their are so many bitter loners/cynics around. :brow:

I don’t see anything bad on the low population rate here. Better to have only some trolls than a whole army of em.

Read full topic

item.description:
ShadowNate:

However, the point of this thread is to organise dev quotes related to the release, and you should definately check the original post in this thread. It links to far more updated quotes like e.g.

Sorry, I wasn’t aware whether the first page was linking to the rumor, or a later confirming of the rumor by Raminator. And I agree my post wasn’t crucial or very intersting news, I’ve just been trying to liven up this place recently. (I think I’ve revived around 2-3 threads by now)

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: ShadowNate
item.description:
TheDragonMask:

I found this on the 33rd page of the Got a Question thread. Thought it might be interesting for some, considering the things we thought were set in stone are now melting away.

However, the point of this thread is to organise dev quotes related to the release, and you should definately check the original post in this thread. It links to far more updated quotes like e.g.

Raminator:

The soundtrack will be released two weeks before the mod. Just because the soundtrack is finalised doesn’t mean it is going to be available for download yet, which is what I already said:You’re reading into it too much.

Read full topic

item.source: Developer quotes on release and process

item.title: Developer quotes on release and process
item.dc:creator: TheDragonMask
item.description:
Raminator:
Dias:

I thought they were going to release the soundtrack a week or so before release? Unless that idea was dropped some time ago, and I didn’t hear about it.

It was never an actual fact, it was just a bit of baseless speculation that somehow became popular “knowledge”. A bit like most religions.

I found this on the 33rd page of the Got a Question thread. Thought it might be interesting for some, considering the things we thought were set in stone are now melting away. (I’m on an insane quest to read all of that thread, as you can see I’m only around 3.7% and I’ve been at it on and off for a week)

This is another interesting one. I’m not sure but DK 2009/10/11 still hasn’t released right?

Paul Peloski:
Deathmonkey7:

I thought the 2009/10 engines were unusable to mods, or are we speaking of future revisions? Or have they been fixed?

Currently there is no SDK for the 2009/2010 but I would expect that to change pretty soon. If Valve delays the SDK for too long we’ll obviously release on the old engine, but I think it’s pretty likely we’ll be able to release on the new engine.

Read full topic
item.source: Developer quotes on release and process
